author: holiman
content: Yes, first slot after range. Reasoning: the server iterates leafs, and eventually goes beyond the range. Instead of discarding the last element, it includes it. (This goes for all responses, not just empties)

author: suburbandad_
content: Ah ok.  The besu implementation is checking strict range boundaries, and only seeks past the range if we encounter an empty range.  Our storage interfaces limit and wrap db iterators for safety reasons, but it might be worth changing some of the plumbing to avoid the extra seek in case of an empty range ðŸ¤”
